Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for friday, october 10th. meta platforms is introducing new ai tools designed to optimize digital ads. this move comes as the company aims to solidify its position in the competitive digital advertising market by leveraging advanced machine learning algorithms to enhance targeting and ad effectiveness. meta hopes these innovations will help advertisers reach their audiences more efficiently and drive better engagement.

meanwhile, alphabet's google is rolling out a major update to its search algorithm. this update, called "mum" or multitask unified model, is designed to better understand complex user queries and improve search results across different languages. google's latest advancement signals its ongoing commitment to refining user experience and maintaining its dominance in the search engine space.

shares of microsoft are on the rise after the tech giant reported strong quarterly earnings, driven by robust growth in its cloud computing division, azure. the company cited increased demand for cloud services as businesses continue their digital transformations in the wake of the pandemic. analysts are optimistic about microsoft's future growth potential as it continues to expand its cloud offerings.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, october 10th. meta platforms is unveiling new ai tools designed to optimize digital ads. this initiative marks the company's strategic move to bolster its presence in the highly competitive digital advertising space. by leveraging advanced machine learning algorithms, meta aims to enhance ad targeting and effectiveness, helping advertisers reach their audiences more efficiently and drive superior engagement.

turning to google, alphabet's tech giant is rolling out a significant update to its search algorithm. dubbed "mum," or multitask unified model, this update is engineered to better interpret complex user queries and improve search results across multiple languages. google's latest advancement underscores its ongoing dedication to refining user experience and solidifying its stronghold in the search engine market.

shares of microsoft are climbing as the tech behemoth reported robust quarterly earnings, fueled by impressive growth in its cloud computing division, azure. the uptick is attributed to increased demand for cloud services as businesses accelerate their digital transformations post-pandemic. analysts remain optimistic about microsoft's growth trajectory as it continues to expand its cloud offerings.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow

Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for friday, october 10th! explore the latest in tech news:

  • meta's new ai advertising tools: meta platforms is launching advanced ai tools to optimize digital advertisements, aiming to improve ad targeting and engagement through cutting-edge machine learning algorithms.
  • google's "mum" algorithm update: google is enhancing its search algorithm with the "mum" update, designed to better interpret complex queries and provide improved multilingual search results, highlighting its commitment to user experience.
  • microsoft's earnings surge: microsoft reports strong quarterly earnings, driven by significant growth in its azure cloud computing division, as demand for cloud services remains high following the pandemic-induced shift to digital workflows.

join us tomorrow for more tech insights!
